Submodules

endemo2.model_instance.model.country module

class Country(country_name, country_instance_filter, ind_if, prod_if, cts_if, hh_if, tra_if)[source]

Bases: object

The Country connects all transport and data from a single country. It is a completely self-contained unit.

Parameters:

  • country_name (str) – Name of the country.

  • country_instance_filter (CountryInstanceFilter) – The instance filter for the country.

  • ind_if (IndustryInstanceFilter) – The instance filter for the industry. Is passed on to the industry object.

  • prod_if (ProductInstanceFilter) – The instance filter for the products. Is passed on to the industry object.

  • cts_if (CtsInstanceFilter) –

  • hh_if (HouseholdsInstanceFilter) –

  • tra_if (TransportInstanceFilter) –

Variables:

  • _country_name (str) – The name of the country (en).

  • _sectors (dict[SectorIdentifier, Sector]) – The sector objects for this country, accessible by the sector identifier.

calculate_total_demand()[source]

Sum the demand over all transport of the country.

Return type:

Demand

Returns:

The demand for a country summed over all transport.

get_sector(sector_id)[source]

Getter for the transport of a country. Accessed by the transport’ identifier.

Parameters:

sector_id (SectorIdentifier) – Identifies Sector by enum value from SectorIdentifier.

Return type:

Sector

Returns:

The countries_in_group sector corresponding to the sector id.

endemo2.model_instance.model.sector module

class Sector(country_name, instance_filter)[source]

Bases: object

The parent class for all sectors. Contains what different sectors have in common.

Variables:

  • _country_name (str) – The name of the country this sector belongs to.

  • _instance_filter (InstanceFilter) – The instance filter of the sector.

Parameters:

country_name (str) –

calculate_demand()[source]

Calculate demand of the transport sector.

Return type:

Demand

Returns:

The demand summed over all _subsectors in this transport sector.

calculate_demand_distributed_by_nuts2()[source]

Calculate demand distributed by nuts2 regions.

Return type:

dict[str, Demand]

Returns:

The demand summed over all subsector in this households sector, split by nuts2 regions.
